docs.text: a bleak look at how the boston underworld operates , a film which was based on the best-seller by george v . , higgins .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is seen through the weary eyes of a 51-year-old , small-time hood , eddie " fingers " coyle ( mitchum ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he got the nickname when a mob boss in his underworld element shut the draw on his hand as a punishment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his current dilemma is that he got caught running illegal booze by truck and faces a 3-5 year stretch in new hampshire , something he feels will be a life sentence for him since he doesn't think he could survive prison at his age .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is also concerned that his wife and three kids will have to go on welfare .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he could have cut a deal and gotten off , if he turned his boss over to the d . a . , but he figured he would never live if he did that .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is currently gun-running for a gang of very successful bank robbers led by scalise ( rocco ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the masked bank robbers operate by always first going to the bank manager's house and holding his family hostage and then they go to the bank and force the manager to open the vault for them or else his family gets it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: on one of the heists , they kill a bank officer who pushes the alarm .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: coyle's best friend is dillon ( boyle ) , a hit man for the mob , working as a bartender .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is a permanent stoolie for the treasury agents , as an aggressive young agent named foley ( jordan ) , who likes to be called uncle , gives dillon breathing room to operate some of his low-level crime activities and to work the bar even though he has a prison record , as long as he keeps getting valuable info from him on things happening with the gangs .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with the sentencing date closing in on him , the already convicted coyle is out on bail and looking for an angle to cut his jail time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he contacts agent foley and gives him a few inconsequential tips and then decides to do something that goes against his grain .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: thinking he made an iron-clad deal with foley to get his sentenced squashed in new hampshire , he gives him the place where a sale of machine guns is going down , knowing full-well the young hustler ( keats ) selling the guns is a lot like he was as a youth and when arrested will be facing a life sentence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but foley tells him after he arrests the gun-dealer , that new hampshire wants more before they take away his jail sentence , they want him to be a full-time informer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: warning : spoiler follows in next paragraph .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the bank robbers are setup and caught in the act and the mob boss is convinced coyle did it and gives dillon the contract to take care of his friend .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the contemptuous dillon befriends coyle and treats him to a steak dinner and takes him to a bruin hockey game while getting him boozed up .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: coyle takes a look at the young bruin star bobby orr from his upper deck seat and says , " to be young like that and have his future , he's the greatest hockey player in the world . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dillon then takes the drunken coyle for a long drive and executes him mob-style , having a kid who works for him dump the body in some bad section of boston .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is a great atmospheric film due to the realistic noir mood it sets , of the hopeless situation the low-level criminals are in , and how they are forced to live with fear and the uncertainty of what horrible thing will happen next .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the city streets are ugly , the gangsters are shown to be capable of any action to defend their own interests , whether it is betrayal or murder .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is a fatalistic feel about their lives , something robert mitchum wears as easily as others put on a hat .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: mitchum gives this film all the intensity and purpose it needs , as it overcomes a thin plot .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it makes you see the characters for what they are without any false sympathy for them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: mitchum is a loser ; and , that he lived so long , is a tribute to his skills as a survivor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but in the end , he even loses the respect he had among his underworld friends as a standup guy , as he wrestled with his code of honor and lost even that battle .
docs.label: positive
